00031 // Time values (expressed in processor cycles)
00032 typedef unsigned long long Time;
00033 
00034 // Macro to convert nanosecs into number of processor cycles
00035 #define nano_to_cycles(nano,frequency) ((nano*frequency)/1000)
00036 #define cycle_to_sec(cycle,frequency) ((cycle/frequency) / 1000000)
00037 #define cycle_to_nano(cycle,frequency) ( (1000*cycle/frequency) % 1000000000)

00039 #define min(a,b)  (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00040 #define max(a,b)  (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00041 
00042 // Divide and either round up or down 
00043 #define divRoundDown(n,s)  ((n) / (s))
00044 #define divRoundUp(n,s)    (((n) / (s)) + ((((n) % (s)) > 0) ? 1 : 0))

00046 // This declares the type "VoidFunctionPtr" to be a "pointer to a
00047 // function taking an integer argument and returning nothing".  With
00048 // such a function pointer (say it is "func"), we can call it like this:
00049 //
00050 //      (*func) (17);
00051 //
00052 // This is used by Thread::Fork and for interrupt handlers, as well
00053 // as a couple of other places.
00054 
00055 
00056 typedef void (*VoidFunctionPtr)(int arg); 
00057 typedef void (*VoidNoArgFunctionPtr)(); 
00058 
00059 
00060 // Include interface that isolates us from the host machine system library.
00061 // Requires definition of bool, and VoidFunctionPtr
00062 #include "sysdep.h"                             
00063

00076 // ASSERT
00083 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 #define ASSERT(condition)                                                     \
00085     if (!(condition)) {                                                       \
00086         fprintf(stderr, "Assertion failed: line %d, file \"%s\"\n",           \
00087                 __LINE__, __FILE__);                                          \
00088         fflush(stderr);                                                       \
00089         Abort();                                                              \
00090     }
